name: Aston Villa FC History Quiz | Aston Villa | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was Aston Villa's original name?
questions.explanation:
Aston Villa.

	Aston Villa have always had this name since their formation in 1874.

questions.text: Were Aston Villa founder members of the football league?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	In the first season of the football league in 1888-89, Villa finished second, eleven points behind Preston North End who won the league title without losing a single game. The 12 founder members were: Accrington Stanley, Aston Villa, Blackburn Rovers, Bolton Wanderers, Burnley, Derby County, Everton, Notts County, Preston North End, Stoke City, West Bromwich Albion and Wolverhampton Wanderers.

questions.text: When did Aston Villa win their first league title?
questions.explanation:
1894.

	Villa were the league champions four times in the 19th century, in 1894, 1896, 1897 and 1899.

questions.text: How many times did Villa win the FA Cup during the 20th century?
questions.explanation:
4.

	They won the cup in 1887, 1895 and 1897 in the 19th century, and in 1905, 1913, 1920 and 1957 in the 20th.

questions.text: Which of these players scored the most goals for Villa?
questions.explanation:
Billy Walker.

	Walker scored 244 goals in 531 games between 1920-33.

questions.text: Which ground did Aston villa first use as their home?
questions.explanation:
Aston Park.

	Villa played at Aston Park between 1874 to 1876, until they moved to Perry Barr where they stayed until 1896, when Villa Park became their home.

questions.text: Who was Villa's first manager in their history?
questions.explanation:
George Ramsey.

	Ramsey managed the club for an astounding 42 years between 1884 to 1926!

questions.text: Who scored the goal that gave Villa their first European Cup in 1982?
questions.explanation:
Peter Withe & Withe.

	The final took place on 26th May, 1982 between Villa and Bayern Munich at the Feyenoord Stadium, Rotterdam, Holland. Villa won their game 1-0 thanks to Withe's 67th minute strike.

questions.text: What team did Villa beat 12-2 in 1892?
questions.explanation:
Accrington Stanley.

	This game set the record for their highest victory.

questions.text: Which of these players scored the most goals in one season for Villa?
questions.explanation:
Tom 'Pongo' Waring.

	Waring scored 49 goals in the 1930-31 season, and scored 167 goals in 226 games. 'Pongo' gained this nickname as he reminded people of the Queen's pet dragon, on a television show called 'The Tales of Rubova'. Thanks for taking this quiz.
